text: David, our VP, is the reason my life works. Took over check-signing when Haley was born and still does it today.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Business can be a powerful force of change—there’s something significant in the community work we do. I'm proud to create jobs & give back.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: One of my favorite & proudest things as a business owner is our pro-bono work. Every year, we donate a year's worth of work to a non-profit.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: The Wall of Inspiration: Staff members select who inspires them & we put them up. (Can you spot me & Gloria Steinem?)

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We're really proud of our space because we built it together. Now, clients bring us things to add to the "museum."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We should remove barriers so we can focus on the important things: Supporting employees, doing good work, & contributing to our communities.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Owning a business—managing projects, budgets, and people—is a lot of work. The people aspect can be the toughest and the most rewarding.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: I never meant to start a company. I studied fine art at UNH (to my parents' horror)—but I was lucky to have the support to do what I loved.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: The best part of owning my own business: It enabled me to become a single mom at 40, and gives me security & flexibility to be a mom now.

text: Hillary tells Donald Trump: Enough.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "The defining economic challenge of our time is clear: We must raise wages for hard-working Americans."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Hillary stands up for workers against GOP attacks: "They don’t need a lecture — they need a raise."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I’m running for President to build an America for tomorrow, not yesterday—where if you do your part, you will reap the rewards."—Hillary

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Above all, we have to break out of the poisonous partisan gridlock and focus on the long-term needs of our country."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Let's get back to making decisions that rely on evidence more than ideology."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Workers are assets. Investing in them pays off. Higher wages pay off. And training pays off."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "When all Americans have the chance to study hard, work hard, and share in our country’s prosperity—that’s fair growth."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "To create fair growth, we need to create opportunity for more Americans."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "If we want to get serious about raising incomes, we have to get serious about supporting union workers."

author: @HillaryClinton
text:
"Let him tell that to the fast food workers marching in the streets for better pay.

They don’t need a lecture—they need a raise."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "You may have heard Gov. Bush say last week that Americans just need to work longer hours. He must not have met very many American workers."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "As President, I’ll fight to put families first—just like I have my entire career."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "For far too long, these challenges have been dismissed by some as 'women’s issues.' Well, those days are over."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "It’s way past time to end the outrage of so many women still earning less than men on the job—and women of color making even less."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "It’s time to recognize that quality, affordable child care is not a luxury—it’s a growth strategy."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "We can’t afford to leave talent on the sidelines."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Another key to strong growth that often goes overlooked & undervalued: Breaking down barriers to joining the workforce—especially for women.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I know it’s not always how we think about this, but another engine of strong growth should be comprehensive immigration reform."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I want to see our economy work for the struggling, the striving, and the successful."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Wages need to rise to keep up with costs. Paychecks need to grow. Families who work hard & do their part deserve to get ahead & stay ahead.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We can’t go back to the old policies that failed us before.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "For 35 years, Republicans have argued that if we give more wealth to those at the top...it will trickle down to everyone else."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Today on the 25th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, Adam, Dale & I are thrilled to spend the day with Hillary. #ADA25

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We know Hillary’s a fighter & that she’ll fight for Adam as President just like she did at the Children’s Defense Fund & in Congress.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Iowa's @SenatorHarkin co-authored the ADA. We're proud to have been represented by such a strong champion for people with disabilities.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Later that night, she joined us to talk about the big questions that really need to be asked—for Adam, and for everyone fighting for a cure.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "What do we have here?" she asked. Adam's father came over, thanking Hillary for her commitment to epilepsy research with a hug.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: I’ll never forget the first time Adam met Hillary. At a dinner in 2007, Adam broke away from us & ran up to her.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Adam's teacher said, "We’ll make it happen—that's our job." The rest is history. He has loved, loved it.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: She told me that he was a great runner! I just thought, "How would this happen?" I knew it should happen, but I also knew the challenges.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We’re grateful for supportive teachers. In junior high, his PE teacher called & asked if Adam would go for cross country.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Through Adam, we informally raise awareness for people with disabilities every day: It's as simple as taking pride in the small things.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: We’ll rely on organizations in our community, because Adam will need training, direction & safety as an adult.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: One thing that concerns us as Adam gets older is what happens after he finishes school.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: The ADA ensures Adam & Turbo are welcome everywhere. Turbo even joined us at Wrigley Field for a @Cubs game!

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Adam’s service dog Turbo is a huge part of our lives. He goes everywhere with Adam, including school.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: He’s always doing that.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: During the school year, Adam's a member of the cross country team. I never imagined he'd be a runner like me & Dale, but he proved us wrong.

author: @HillaryClinton
text: His father Dale & I work, so Adam spends summer days at @TheArcUS. Yesterday we celebrated ADA Night at @CRKernels!

text: Let's build an economy that works for everyone. Join Hillary: http://hrc.io/economy

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I will appoint and empower regulators who understand that Too Big To Fail is still too big a problem."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I will offer plans to rein in excessive risk on Wall Street and ensure that stock markets work for everyday investors."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Too often it has seemed that the human beings responsible get off with limited consequences...This is wrong—& on my watch, it will change."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: Hillary on misconduct in the financial industry: "There can be no justification or tolerance for this kind of criminal behavior."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Too many pressures in our economy today are pushing us toward short-termism."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "The third key driver of income gains alongside strong growth and fair growth must be long-term growth."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I will propose ways to encourage companies to share profits with their employees. That's good for workers, and good for businesses."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "To get all incomes rising again, we need to strike a better balance. If you work hard, you ought to be paid fairly."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "The evidence is in: Inequality is a drag on our entire economy. This is the problem we need to tackle."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "When we leave people out, or write them off, we not only shortchange them—we shortchange our country and shortchange our future."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "There’s no excuse not to make greater investments in cleaner, renewable energy right now."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Bringing millions of hard-working people into the formal economy would increase our GDP by an estimated $700 billion over 10 years."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "More growth means more jobs and more new businesses."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "Today I am proposing an agenda to raise incomes for hard-working Americans. An agenda for strong growth, fair growth, & long-term growth."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "The measure of our success must be how much incomes rise for hard-working families—not just for successful CEOs and money managers."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "As President, I will work with every possible partner to turn the tide—to make these currents of change start working for us."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "[Changes in our economy] don’t determine our destiny. The choices we make as a nation matter."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "The defining economic challenge of our time is clear: We must raise incomes for hard-working Americans."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I believe we have to build a 'growth and fairness' economy. You can’t have one without the other."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "That bargain has eroded. Our job is to make it strong again."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "If you work hard and do your part, you should be able to get ahead. And when you get ahead, America gets ahead."

author: @HillaryClinton
text: "I’ve had the opportunity to listen to Americans’ concerns about an economy that still isn’t delivering for them the way it should."—Hillary
